properties.name: 2nd Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021 When people say "Statue of Liberty" they usually mean the one in NYC, but not many have heard of this one.This one is located near the Grenelle Bridge and about a mile from the Eiffel Tower in Paris,France.The statue was dedicated on Nov. 15,1889 while looking toward the Atlantic Ocean and hence looking toward it\'s "larger sister" in NYC. This one might look familiar to some people because it was recently shown in National Treasure:Book of Secrets.Its height is about 35ft high.How this statue came about when Americans in Paris appreciated the other Statue of Liberty so much, they decided to build one in Paris.

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021London Big Ben is one of London\'s best known landmarks while also a well known attraction around the world. The name actually refers to the 13-ton bell hung within the tower.The bell was named after Sir Benjamin Hall, commissioner of works.The bell originally came from the old Palace of Westminster.William III gave it to the Dean of St.Paul\'s there. The tower itself is 314ft high.The four dials of the clock are broken into 23ft squares.Even the minute hand alone is 14 ft long. There is a pendulum inside the tower to keep the clock accurate. Edmund Dension invented the pendulum.It is 3.9m beats every two seconds and weighs 300 kgs.

properties.name: Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021 Although the Colosseum is elliptical in shape it is also 159ft high and the arena is 249 by 144ft.There are 4 stories with 80 arches on every floor, and the ancient capacity was calculated from between 50,000 and 75,000 spectators.It took 10 years to complete the whole thing, but the architect is unknown.The name "Colosseum" dates all the way back to the 11th century.Chariot races were held and free men who fought for a living called gladiators also were always in the arena. 300 tons of metal was used for the iron clamps that connect the limestone blocks together.Because of the medival times,the iron clamps extracted creating holes and are the holes you still see today.The floor of the Colosseum is made up of masonry and part wood.In the year 2005, there were 3,880,179 visitors who came to see the ancient arena.Today, over 200 cats live inside the Colosseum.

properties.name: Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021Paris France 75007 The Eiffel Tower is located on the Southern bank of the Seine River.It is the highest structure in Paris with about108 stories and the base covers almost the exact area of two American football fields placed side-by-side lengthwise.It took Gustave Eiffel and his engineering firm 2 years to build the tower.Eiffel\'s firm has also designed and built the interior frame of the Statue of Liberty in NYC.The reason for building it was because of the Universal Exposition of 1889.It was supposly the "theme structure". After the exposition, people wanted to tear it down, but the military wanted it to stay because it was a great radio atenna.Soon people started to like it and didn\'t want to tear it down. Because of the unique latticework of metal, it is more likely to trigger fear of heights in people.Some people believe it\'s made of steel but i\'s really made of iron.There are urban legends that some people also believe;they say U.S. gave the tower to France in exchange for the Statue of Liberty.Right now the City of Paris is the tower\'s owner who are in charge of running it and maitinance.The color is called "Eiffel Tower beige" and needs to be repainted over 6-7 year periods.There is a small post office in the tower and you have to use the elevator only to reach the summit.The tower also attracts not only young lovers but depressed or suicidal people. There was nearly 400 people who jumped off the tower to kill themselves.the price to build coorsponds to about 5,000,000 US dollars in 2006 and Eiffel Tower in French is "la Tour Eiffel".

properties.name: Ford's Theater
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021Â Washington D.C. In 1861, a theater entrepreneur named John T. Ford started to lease out a church which he turned into a music hall.Right after that it got completely destroyed in a fire.So in August 1863 he started to rebulid it as Ford\'s "New Theater".Less than two years later President Lincoln attended a performance called "Our American Cousin" and got shot by John Wilk\'s Booth. The public demanded closure of the theater after the death of Lincoln and made threats to destruct the building.For the next ninety years, the theater served as office space, museum, and storage facility.President Dwight D. Eisenhower then signed the Congressional act to restore the theater. Ten years later reconstruction began and finally reopened in 1968.Today, it is a historical site as well as a working theater.

properties.name: Fort McHenry
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021 Fort McHenry is located right near Baltimore\'s Inner Harbor area.History began during the Revolutionary War in 1776 when Baltimore residents feared a British attack, so they built Fort McHenry.They named the fort after a politician who provided most of the funds for the project named James McHenry.Then during the War of 1812 British forces bombarded the fort for 25 hours and then gave up the fort because they could not destroy it. Francis Scott Key noticed the flag was still flying despite the attack, and so it was his poem that he wrote that day that was put to music and later became our national anthem.Today, there is a monument to Francis at Fort McHenry.The fort is a popular destination for for field trips by surrounding schools and tourists.There is even a Fort McHenry Guard which is a group of re-enactors who dress in period garb and help interpret Fort McHenry\'s past and place in history.

properties.name: Golden gate bridge
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021 The Golden Gate Bridge is considered the entrance to the San Francisco Bay form the Pacific Ocean.It\'s 3 miles long by 1 mile wide with a 4,200ft long suspension span.It took 4 years to build by starting on Jan.5,1933 and opened to traffic on May 28, 1937.The cost taday in 2003 dollars would be approx. 1.2 billion to build another one.11 men were killed during construction.Before completion, Chief Engineer Joseph B.Strauss wrote a poem called "The Mighty Task is Done". On opening day, the bridge was considered by the San Francisco Chronicle "A thirty-five million dollar steel harp!".Since that opening day, as of June 2005, 1,779,032,891 vehicles crossed it. It is the first bridge in the workd to offer one-way toll collection.Due to weather conditions the bridge has closed 3 times.The color of the bridge is "International Orange" and is mostly used because of its great visibility in the fog.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021Philadelphia The most interesting thing about the Liberty Bell is the crack.Although there are many legends of when it really cracked, there is really no definate date.They do know it was sometime between 1817 and 1846.When Independence Hall completed their bell tower, the Pennsylvania Assembly Speaker, Isaac Norris hired a London agent, Robert Charles, to buy a bell "about 2000 pounds." When it was eventually put in the tower, many people questioned if the sound was good or not, but thankfully soon accepted it. The bell weighs 2,080 pounds and is 12ft around the bottom.At the time, it costed only 25.It is mostly made up of copper and tin, but there are other trace amounts of silver, gold and magnesium. Today, it is owned by the City of Philadelphia.There are also a replica bel in each of the 50 states as a gift from France to ring on special occasions.There was even a "Liberty Bell Hoax".I t was on April 1,1996 that a full-page Taco Bell advertisement popped up in The New York Times announcing that Taco Bel had purchased the Liberty Bell in effort to help reduce national debt. They even claimed to rename the bell as "Taco Liberty Bell".Of course it turned out to be just a hoax.

properties.name: Mark Twain's House
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021Hartford CT 06105 In 1873, samuel Langhorne Clemens a.k.a."Mark Twain" purchased land in an area known as Nook Farm in Hartford, Connecticut.He hired architect Edward Tuckerman Potter to design his house.The house was eventually complete and he moved into it in September of 1874. He actually only lived in the house from 1874 to 1891.During his stay at that particular house, he wrote many of his famous literary works like the adventures of Huckleberry Finn and Tom Sawyer.Now, his house has been restored and is very famous for it\'s beautiful Louis Comfort Tiffany interior decorations and furniture.

properties.name: Mount Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Websta1021Keystone,South Dakota 57751-0268 It cost Gutzon Borglum 89,992.32 to build Mount Rushmore along with 400 other workers.It was named after an attorney from NYC named Charles E. Rushmore who was there just on business.It took 14 years to complete the whole project.Thankfully, there were no deaths or accidents during the 14 years. 90% of Mt.Rushmore was carved using dynamite.The estimated erosion rate is 1 inch for every 10,000 years.Mount rushmore host almost 3 million visitors every year from across the country and across the entire world.
